ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A fundamental understanding of automated reasoning.
Much more knowledge about formal methods

I gained the ability to reason about formal methods and design programs which implement these techniques. I feel confident learning more about and building upon formal methods going forward thanks to this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Ruzica is a good lecturer and is passionate about teaching the subject. The coding assignments are a bit unguided though.
Great programming assignments, they were interesting and helped learn the concepts

The strengths of this course were the projects in my opinion. They did a great job at combining many different ideas within formal methods while also building something of value. One weakness for the course was that sometimes lectures were difficult to follow. I think that some lectures made jumps to different ideas throughout the course quite frequently and it was difficult to reason about them linearly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's an interesting subject that is not often studied and dicussed by CS majors at Yale.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because the topics and projects are very valuable in my opinion. The instructors also did a good job of being available, ready to answer questions, and accommodate students.
